title: US FDA advisers to weigh composition of COVID vaccines for 2025-2026
description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administrations advisory panel is set to vote on Thursday to recommend whether COVID-19 vaccines for the 2025-2026 immunization campaign should target strains of the virus descending from the JN.1 variant.

title: Kenyan court finds two guilty of aiding 2019 Nairobi hotel attack
description: NAIROBI - A Kenyan court on Thursday found two people guilty of aiding a 2019 attack by al Qaeda-linked militants on a hotel and office complex in the capital that killed 21 people, the presiding judge said.

title: Brazil hopes to be officially free of bird flu in 28 days
description: SAO PAULO - Brazil began a 28-day bird flu observation period on Thursday which it hopes will show the countrys chicken farms are free of the disease after local authorities said a farm where its first outbreak was detected had been fully disinfected.

title: Small plane crashes into San Diego residential street
description: It smashed into houses and set multiple cars ablaze.

title: Person in custody after reported shooting at CIA headquarters
description: WASHINGTON - The CIA said its security personnel took a person into custody early Thursday after an engagement outside the intelligence agencys headquarters.

title: Palestinian minister reports 29 starvation-related deaths among Gazan children, elderly
description: GENEVA - The Palestinian health minister said on Thursday that 29 children and elderly people had died from starvation-related deaths in Gaza in recent days and that many thousands more were at risk.

title: Kenya says Tanzanian authorities have released activist
description: DAR ES SALAAM - Tanzania has released a Kenyan activist who had been arrested after he tried to attend a hearing in the treason case against a detained opposition leader in Dar es Salaam, Kenyan authorities said on Thursday.

title: Irish band Kneecap say terrorism charge seeks to silence artists
description: LONDON - Irish-language rap band Kneecap said on Thursday that a charge of a terrorism offence against one of its members for displaying a flag of banned militant group Hezbollah represented an attempt to prosecute artists who speak out.

title: Greece says Turkey must lift war threat to get access to EU defence funds
description: ATHENS - Turkey must lift a 30-year old war threat against Greece if it wants Athens to consent to Ankara accessing European Union defence funds, Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said on Thursday.

title: Final report on Lucy Letby baby murders due in early 2026, inquiry says
description: LONDON - The final report of a public inquiry into the murder of seven newborn babies by British nurse Lucy Letby will be published early next year, a statement on the inquirys website said on Thursday.

title: Iran warns Israel, US against any attack on its nuclear sites

title: US climate pullback threatens planned debt-for-nature deals

title: Global vaccine and health bodies could team up more to tackle US-led funding crisis

description: MOSCOW - A Russian court on Tuesday extended the pre-trial detention of Vadim Moshkovich, the billionaire founder of Russias top agriculture company Rusagro who faces charges of embezzlement, until August 25, his lawyer told Reuters.

title: Whats in the EUs new Russia sanctions
description: BRUSSELS - The European Union adopted on Tuesday its 17th package of sanctions against Russia over its full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

title: US asking countries for voluntary relocation of Palestinians, says Rubio
description: President Donald Trump has repeatedly mused about displacing Gazas two million people to make way for reconstruction.

title: Uganda passes law to restore military prosecutions of civilians
description: KAMPALA - Ugandas parliament on Tuesday passed an amended law that permits military tribunals to try civilians, prompting protests from the opposition who said the move violated a Supreme Court ruling in January that banned such trials.

title: EU to impose 3 flat fee on small parcels from outside bloc
description: E-commerce platforms would be expected to pay the levy on these parcels, which mostly come from China.

title: UK identifies atypical case of mad cow disease
description: It comes the day after Britain signed an EU deal that includes reducing checks on food and plant products.

title: Hungary says it has identified two more Ukrainian spies
description: BUDAPEST - Hungarian security services have identified two Ukrainian spies, a government spokesman said on Tuesday, the latest in a series of mutual accusations of espionage between Budapest and Kyiv.

title: US expects Russia offer soon as Zelensky sounds warning
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky accused Moscow of buying time.

title: EU proposes allowing deportation of asylum seekers to third countries
description: Anti-immigration sentiment has grown across the 27-nation EU since over a million people arrived in 2015.

title: Rubio says Syria could be weeks away from full-scale civil war of epic proportions
description: The top US diplomat spoke after a series of bloody attacks on the Alawite and Druze minorities in Syria.

title: Mexican ship in Brooklyn Bridge crash made no distress calls, Mexico navy chief says
description: MEXICO CITY - The Mexican Navy ship which crashed into New Yorks Brooklyn Bridge over the weekend made no distress calls before the accident but called for support instead, Mexicos Navy chief Raymundo Morales said on Tuesday.

title: Elon Musk says he will spend a lot less on political campaigns
description: Musk spent a quarter of a billion dollars on US President Donald Trumps election campaign.

title: WHO says vaccine-derived poliovirus detected in Papua New Guinea
description: Poliomyelitis, a highly infectious virus, can invade the nervous system and cause paralysis and death in young children.

title: Two top aides to Mexico City mayor shot dead by motorbike killers
description: MEXICO CITY - Two top aides of Mexico City Mayor Clara Brugada were shot dead after being ambushed by gunmen on a motorbike in a daytime attack in the city center on Tuesday.

title: UK man loses fight against extradition to US over 100 million wine fraud
description: LONDON - A British man accused of defrauding investors out of nearly 100 million through a Ponzi-like scheme involving non-existent luxury wines lost his fight against extradition from Britain to the United States on Tuesday.

title: Russias Lavrov says radical groups engaged in ethnic cleansing in Syria
description: MOSCOWDAMASCUS - Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Tuesday that Moscow is deeply concerned by what he said was ethnic cleansing being carried out by radical militant groups in Syria.

title: Explainer-The new US-backed Gaza aid plan and why the UN doesnt like it
description: UNITED NATIONS - A U.S.-backed organization aims to start work in the Gaza Strip by the end of May overseeing a new model of aid distribution in the Palestinian enclave, but the United Nations says the plan is not impartial or neutral, and it wont be involved.

title: Poland to try suspect in alleged plot by Russia to assassinate Ukraines Zelensky
description: Poland, a hub for Western military supplies to Ukraine, says it has become a major target of Russian spies.
